com.yantra.api.ysc.overrides

Interface checkOverriddenRules

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface checkOverriddenRules
    Evaluate Override Rules to determine if any apply, and return those that apply with a list of potential approvers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document checkOverriddenRules(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The checkOverriddenRules API evaluates a set of Overridden Rules for any violations based on the input criteria, and returns any violations found,

    • Method Detail

      • checkOverriddenRules

        org.w3c.dom.Document checkOverriddenRules(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                          java.rmi.RemoteException

        The checkOverriddenRules API evaluates a set of Overridden Rules for any violations based on the input criteria, and returns any violations found,

        with approvers if applicable. It also will resolve existing violations on a transaction if the conditions for resolution have been met. Please see the manageOverriddedenRule API for information concerning rule inheritance from configuration.

        Validation Domain

        The checkOverriddenRules will perform its regular operations as long as the specified Validation's Domain is enabled. In the event that the Domain

        is disabled, the API will not evaluate any rules for violations and will return a value of Y for the AllowTransaction field of the output.

        Violation Resolution

        The checkOverriddenRules API is designed to handle the resolution of violations whose conditions are no longer present on a given transaction.

        This is done by comparing the list of existing violations found utilizing the input from TransactionInformation and TransactionViolationReference

        elements and comparing that list to the list of new violations found on the current call. The API assumes that if there is no match for an existing violation to a new

        one, the existing violation has been resolved, and will be returned in the API output with the Operation flag set to Delete. Otherwise, the

        the existing violation will be merged to its corresponding new violation, and will be returned in the API output with the Operation flag set to Create.

        Please see the Product Overview and Configuring basic settings of Documentation for further information.

        Reference Matching

        When the checkOverriddenRules API searches for any existing violation that matches a new one, it utilizes the input in the TransactionViolationReference

        element to compare the associated references. These references can be either Primary, Non-Primary, or Informational. Matching is done using only the Primary and Non-Primary

        references. Informational References are only intended to store non-operational metadata about a given violation. The references of a violation are dictated by the Validation

        References configured for the violation's Validation. These references are also considered by this API during runtime. An error will be thrown in the references passed in this

        API's input do not conform to Validation References configured for the Validation specificed in the input. Please see the Product Overview and Configuring basic settings of Documentation for further information.

        Approval Reoccurrence

        The checkOverriddenRules API handles the presence of existing violations on a transaction as a part of its general operation. However, certain Validations,

        such as Age Verification, require that if an approval is recorded for a specific Overridden Rule's violation, that approval should persist for any new occurrences

        of that violation found over the course of the transaction. In other scenarios, violations should always be treated as new instances, and previous approvals should

        not apply to them. To implement both of these use cases, this API will use the specificed Validation's Is_Approval_Required_On_Reoccurence to determine which of these

        behaviors to honor.

        Configuration Group Filtering

        If the specified Validation has a ConfigurationGroup that corresponds to a YFS_Base_Config_Grp_Defn record that has filtering enabled, the

        rules used in Greex evaluation will be filtered before processing. All active rules found using the passed input criteria will be subject to filtering based on the

        configured Region Schema for the Enterprise. Please see the Product Overview and Configuring basic settings of Documentation for further information.

        Manually Passing Transaction Violations

        In the event that Transaction Violations need to be passed manually, rather than letting the API search for valid Overridden Rules and evaluating them, the

        checkOverriddenRules API supports the use of the TransactionViolationList element. This element in the input XML can be used to specify details

        about a set of Transaction Violations, including Approvers and Violation References. The element is optional and does not need to be passed for the

        API to function. If the element is passed, Rule Search and Evaluation will not take place, and only the Transaction Violations passed in the element

        will be used for Violation Resolution. Also, if the element is passed, all attributes required elsewhere by the API, such as CallingOrganizationCode and

        DocumentType, are still required and must be passed to avoid an input error, whereas the attributes listed as required under the TransactionViolationList

        element and its children are only required if the element is passed.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exit if Is_User_Exit is set on is Input Validation:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalDataForValidationUE

          Events Raised: None

          Audits: None

          Pre-conditions: None

          Post-conditions: None

          Output Template Support: Yes

          Database Extensibility Support: No

          Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

          Additional Information:

        Parameters:
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
